task.summary:
kernels can now have a callback that is fired when the kernel's execution is finished
PACXX provides a wrapper for std::promise which hold a bound object that is bound to the lifetime of the promise. when the promise is fulfilled that BindingPromise transfers ownership of the bound object the its future object. This is necessary since CUDA does not allow calls to CUDA API functions from within a Callback (stupid...)

removed some stupid ideas from last night
Callbacks are now bound to the Kernel instance launched
rewrite of kernel name lookup to support not only lambdas (which are partly broken at this time) but also functor objects

This is necessary since CUDA does not allow calls to CUDA API functions from within a Callback (stupid...)
